headline: A divided three-judge panel rejected the Trump administration’s effort to block California’s new congressional map that adds five new Democratic-leaning districts for the 2026 midterm elections
President Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act , a 19th century law that could allow him to deploy the military inside the U.S., in response to protests in Minnesota
Top officials from Denmark and Greenland said after a visit to the White House that they hadn’t yet persuaded President Trump to abandon his ambitions to annex Greenland
While there is no U.S. aircraft-carrier strike group in the Middle East, officials insist there are sufficient military assets in the region to strike Iran
US forces seize a sixth Venezuela-linked oil tanker in Caribbean Sea
Video shows woman dragged from car by ICE agents in Minneapolis as she tells them she's autistic
The Health and Human Services Department has reversed around $2 billion in grant cuts to substance-abuse and mental-health programs
JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon had been rebuilding his relationship with the president, serving as a model for other executives, but the fight over Fed chair Powell threatens to topple it.
UK 'considering options' as Russia expels British diplomat over spy claims
2 dead in Thailand after crane crashes onto road — a day after crane from same construction firm fell on train, killing 32
